commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I subtracted the percentage of college and university students who had smoked tobacco from a hookah (40.3%) from 100% to find the percentage of students who claim to have never used a hookah. Therefore, the percentage of college students who claim to have never used a hookah in 2011 is 59.7%. 

To solve the problem better, it would have been helpful to have more information about the study, such as the sample size and the demographics of the participants. Additionally, it would have been useful to have more recent data to see if the percentage of college students who claim to have never used a hookah has changed over time.
final_answer: The percentage of college students who claim to have never used a hookah in 2011 is 59.7%.
problem_text:
Context:
In cities with indoor smoking bans, hookah bars have been forced to close or switch to tobacco-free mixtures. In many cities though, hookah lounges have been growing in popularity. From the year 2000 to 2004, over 200 new hookah cafés opened for business, most of them targeted at young adults and located near college campuses or cities with large Middle-Eastern communities. This activity continues to gain popularity within the post-secondary student demographic. Hookah use among high school students rose from 4.1% to 9.4% from 2011 to 2014 while cigarette smoking decreased from 15.8% to 9.2% during this same time period, according to the US CDC. According to a 2011 study, 40.3 percent of college and university students surveyed had smoked tobacco from a hookah. As of 8 July 2013, at least 1,178 college or university campuses in the U.S. have adopted 100% smokefree campus policies that attempt to eliminate smoking in indoor and outdoor areas across the entire campus, including residences.

Question:
How many percent of college students claim to have never used a hookah in 2011?
